main event: A white star-like object was observed over Red Feather Lakes, Colorado, with a gradual decrease in intensity during the 15-minute sighting.
interesting points: The object was described as a round ball of light, similar to a star, with a constant white light.
The object descended in various star formations, making a 90-degree turn at a 30-degree elevation.
The sighting lasted approximately 15 minutes, with the object's intensity gradually decreasing during the observation.
The observer was a local person who was considered reliable.
The weather conditions at the time were reported as calm.
